snippet: Syria is increasingly isolated in the face of a growing economic crisis, more reliant than ever on credit from its main remaining allies.
abstract: Two years of war have devastated economy of Syria, which is now more reliant than ever on credit lines from Iran, Russia and China, its main remaining allies; some officials in government, in effort to keep prices low, hope to impose measures to tighten state control of economy.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut; and Ben Hubbard from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Syria is increasingly isolated in the face of a growing economic crisis, more reliant than ever on credit from its main remaining allies.

headline.main: Syria Weighs Its Tactics as Pillars of Its Economy Continue to Crumble
headline.print_headline: Syria Weighs Its Tactics, as the Pillars of Its Economy Continue to Crumble

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
